newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded gasoline diffs firm.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded gasoline diffs firm.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent spot unleaded gasoline differentials firmed in Chicago and Group Three Wednesday on strong demand, traders said.

"There's been unusually strong buying demand," one Group Three trader said, adding differentials in the Midwest were drawing support from rising prices on refined products being shipped to the East Coast.

Shell Oil Co said it expected today to restart a 20,000 barrel per day alkylation unit idled by a fire that cut feedstocks and steam to the unit at its 268,000 barrel per day Woods River, Ill., refinery.
Shell said crude runs were trimmed "minimally" following the two-hour fire in a gas plant at the refinery, and the alkylation unit was undamaged.
The market received mixed signals from weekly stocks estimates, with gasoline and distillate inventories up compared to the prior week but still below last year's levels.

Chicago unleaded for prompt November deliveries firmed to 6.75/7.0 cents a gallon over NYMEX December unleaded, with later deliveries steady at 2.75/3.0 cents over the print and premium 3.50 cents higher, traders said.

Group Three unleaded made a similar upward move to bids 4.75 cents a gallon over the print for prompt deliveries and unchanged at 1.25 cent over for later deliveries. Premium was talked 3.0 cents higher.
High sulphur diesel for prompt deliveries was bid even with NYMEX December heating oil and 3.0 cents over the print in Group Three.
